section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: For the purposes of this subchapter, the term:

para.text: “Foreign country” means a government other than:
The District of Columbia, a state, district, commonwealth, territory, or insular possession of the United States; or

Any other government with regard to which the decision in the District of Columbia as to whether to recognize a judgment of that government’s courts is initially subject to determination under the Full Faith and Credit Clause of the United States Constitution.
“Foreign-country judgment” means a judgment of a court of a foreign country.

annotations.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 2 of the Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Recognition Act.
